lines.text: [first lines]
Finished.
[stretching]
Aah!
[picks up and studies walking stick]

[with his back to Watson]
What do you make of it, Watson?
What? Huh,I believe you've got eyes in the back of your head, Holmes.
Well, I have a well-polished coffee pot in front of me.
You impress me, Doctor Mortimer. Was there anything else?
Yes.
Footprints? A man or a woman's?
Mr. Holmes, they were the footprints of a gigantic hound!
[Stapleton and Dr. Watson are talking about the beauties and dangers of the great Grimpen Mire when an distant, unearthly howling is heard]
The moor is full of noises.
But what was it?
The peasants say it is the Hound of the Baskervilles calling for its prey.

It may be that you are not yourself luminous but you are a conductor of light. Some people without possessing genius have a remarkable power for stimulating it. I... I confess that, my dear fellow, I'm very much in your debt.

You interest me very much, Mr. Holmes. I had hardly expected so dolichocephalic a skull, or such well-marked supra-orbital development. Would you have any objection to my running my finger along your parietal fissure?
*Please*, Dr. Mortimer.
A cast of your skull Sir, until the original becomes available?
[Holmes bursts into laughter]
It is not my intention to be fulsome, but I confess, I covet your skull.
Behave and sit down, Dr. Mortimer.
[Gesturing to the chair]

[dog sits beside Mr. Mortimer]
Spot. Yes, good boy.
Well, I presume it was not your phrenological passion which drew you to Baker Street.
Unfortunately it was not, Sir.
It's an ugly, dangerous business, Watson. Believe me, I shall be very glad to have you back safe and sound at Baker Street once more.
It is a worthy setting if the devil did decide to dabble in the affairs of men.
I thought we had a chance of getting to the bottom of this business. All we seem to have done is compound a felony.
I would to God that Holmes were here. Why does he not come?
I'm afraid my duty to Holmes overrode my tact.

[about Beryl Stapleton]
There's a light in her eyes that speaks louder than words.
I was burned in effigy in Fernworthy last week.
If it's one animal on this planet which I cannot abide it is a rabbit.
Really?
Rabbits burrow.
If there's to be danger, then... two guns will be better than one.
When I see a cigarette stub marked Bradley, Oxford Street, I know my friend Watson is in the neighborhood. Be careful of that gun.
I thought you were in Baker Street working on that case of blackmail.
That is what I wished you to think.

[looking at the stew Holmes has made]
It's quite disgusting, Holmes.
Yes. Yes, it is. Well, it's better when it's hot.
This case possesses features which are entirely its own.
[last lines]
I have tickets for 'Les Huguenots' at Covent Garden. A little dinner at Marcini's on the way.
Wonderful, Holmes.
